How to Save the World: One Man, One Cow, One Planet

This film addresses the question: what does an environmentally sustainable food system capable of feeding everyone actually look like?

Looking at India in particular, it tells the tale of '...marginalized farmers...fighting back.Â  By reviving an arcane form of agriculture, they are saving their poisoned lands and exposing the bio-colonialism of multinational corporations.'

Featuring Peter Proctor, 'father of modern bio-dynamics,' this film should prove an intriguing insight into the alternatives to the global, petro-based agriculture and food distribution system that surrounds us today.

Join us for cookies, coffee and tea as we watch How to Save the World and discuss afterwards the implications these ideas might have in our own community.
